qas.question: How many of the poorest families did not have any wealth decline during the financial crisis?
In a Federal Reserve survey of 4,000 households, what percent reported wealth decline between 2007 and 2009?
How many of the richest families had a decrease in total wealth between 2007 and 2009?
How many families at the bottom of the pyramid had a decrease in total wealth between 2007 and 2009?
Which families experienced the least decline in wealth between 2007 and 2009?

context: Typical American families did not fare as well, nor did those "wealthy-but-not wealthiest" families just beneath the pyramid's top. On the other hand, <a0_0>half<a0_0/> of the <a4_0>poorest families<a4_0/> did not have wealth declines at all during the crisis. The Federal Reserve surveyed 4,000 households between 2007 and 2009, and found that the total wealth of <a1_0>63<a1_0/> percent of all Americans declined in that period. <a2_0>77<a2_0/> percent of the richest families had a decrease in total wealth, while only <a3_0>50<a3_0/> percent of those on the bottom of the pyramid suffered a decrease.
